reviews.review_msg: 5% of the course is the participation so you basically need to show up. Had the pleasure of having Denise and she really taught me a lot about art history in ways I've never known before. All of the homework is just reading and writing, and being analytical. Lots of discussion happens during lectures as well. Would love to take nother course w her!

Don't take if you don't have to. Astoundingly disorganized & unengaging. Monotone script-reader who relies on the class to talk when she has no points of her own. Unclear-but-demanding assignments & exams, & their instructions seem to change every time she's asked to clarify. Hard marker, even in participation marks - for a class with no tutorials!

Shes very sweet and knowledgeable - Ill give her that much, and Im sure for face to face classes shes much better, but if the course is remote Id decide against this prof. Shes very unorganized, posts assignments late, mixes up due dates, doesnt know how to zoom works (thank god her TA was always there) and the lectures are very monotone.
